DataElement.preferredName: Patient Chemotherapy Nitrosourea Compound Mitomycin C Radiation Therapy Exclusion Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not applicable indicator related to the administration of chemotherapy and radiation therapy as medical characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Chemotherapy Nitrosourea Compound Mitomycin C Radiation Therapy Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to patient eligibility criteria and the administration of chemotherapy (synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals, for the treatment of cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ) and radiation therapy as medical characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Chemotherapy Nitrosourea Compound Mitomycin C Radiation Therapy Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04):A group of anticancer drugs that can cross the blood-brain barrier. Carmustine (BCNU) and lomustine (CCNU) are nitrosoureas.:A methylazirinopyrroloindoledione antineoplastic antibiotic isolated from the bacterium Streptomyces caespitosus and other Streptomyces bacterial species.  Bioreduced mitomycin C generates oxygen radicals, alkylates DNA, and produces interstrand DNA cross-links, thereby inhibiting DNA synthesis.  Preferentially toxic to hypoxic cells, mitomycin C also inhibits RNA and protein synthesis at high concentrations. (NCI04):Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
Any of a class of alkylating agents that contain both a nitroso group and a urea. They are lipophilic and can cross the blood-brain barrier.

A methylazirinopyrroloindoledione antineoplastic antibiotic isolated from the bacterium Streptomyces caespitosus and other Streptomyces bacterial species.  Bioreduced mitomycin C generates oxygen radicals, alkylates DNA, and produces interstrand DNA cross-links, thereby inhibiting DNA synthesis.  Preferentially toxic to hypoxic cells, mitomycin C also inhibits RNA and protein synthesis at high concentrations. (NCI04)

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received prior ch
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy, targeted small molecular therapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) or targeted therapies within 2 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior targeted therapy, chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy less than or equal to 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior nitrosoureas or mitomycin C within 6 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had systemic cytotoxic chemotherapy or other targeted agents or any other investigational agents within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or immunotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had systemic cytotoxic chemotherapy or other targeted agents or any other investigational agents within half-lives (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to starting the study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had systemic cytotoxic chemotherapy or other targeted agents or any other investigational agents within 4 half-lives (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to starting the study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy, biologic therapy or radiotherapy within 3 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy be discontinued at least 4 weeks prior to starting treatment on this study ( 6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy, radiotherapy or biologic therapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or targeted small molecular therapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) or at least 5 half-lives, whichever is longer, prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any radiotherapy or chemotherapy for their current gynecological cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received chemotherapy within 3 weeks or radiotherapy or targeted therapy 2 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received chemotherapy (including investigational cytotoxic chemotherapy), biologic agents (e.g. targeted therapy or antibodies) or radiotherapy within 4 weeks prior to the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior systemic chemotherapy, biologic therapy or radiotherapy within 3 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks prior to entering the study with the exception of hydroxyurea for cytoreduction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy, radiotherapy immunotherapy or anticancer agents within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 2 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received chemotherapy, radiotherapy (to more than 30% of the bone marrow), or biologic therapy within 30 days (42 days for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 2 weeks (4 weeks for nitrosoureas or systemic mitomycin C) prior to the initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to planned cycle 1 day 1 of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received systemic antineoplastic therapy or radiotherapy for other malignant conditions within 14 days before the first dose of any study drug, except for hydroxyurea?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had prior chemotherapy, radiotherapy or surgery within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received chemotherapy within 3 weeks or radiotherapy within 2 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy, targeted small molecular therapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to first dose of trial treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received chemotherapy or definitive radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C), or palliative radiation within 2 weeks prior to study enrollment or if known, within 5 half-lives of the prior agent (whichever is shorter) and within 1 week between prior therapy and study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received any other investigational agents, have at least 4 half-lives of the agent (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) elapsed prior to starting study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy (except hydroxyurea and all trans retinoic acid [ATRA] which are allowed but have to be stopped the day before induction therapy starts), targeted small molecule therapy (aside from imatinib, dasatinib, or nilotinib), or curative-intent radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C), for a prior curatively treated malignancy, prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy within 3 weeks or radiotherapy within 2 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C)   prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy, targeted small molecule therapy (aside from imatinib, dasatinib, or nilotinib, hydroxyurea, or ATRA), or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks or 5 half-lives, whichever is shorter (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy, targeted small molecular therapy, or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy, radiotherapy, or major surgery within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 3 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to starting study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was treatment with nitrosoureas and mitomycin completed at least 6 weeks earlier and greater than or equal to 2 weeks since any prior administration of a study drug in a Phase 0 or equivalent study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 2 weeks (3 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (2 weeks for Revlimid, 6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?
